column4: My Ubuntu 10.10 became read-only unexpectedly, how to fix it?
I tried to reboot, but it does not boot
I get console and every line begins with "initramfs>"
between, if I installed Windows 7 after Ubuntu(still exists) and I want GRUB menu to appear on startup. I should boot into LiveCD and run "sudo update-grub"?
If I want to make Ubuntu and Windows accessible from GRUB menu
how did you install your OS?
both. which one did you install first?
Ubuntu(usual install), divided HDD into partitions(one for Ubuntu & swap, one for Windows), installed Windows 7
between, I forgot to mention, that filesystem became read-only and no free space
please install windows first and ubuntu last. this is because windows doesn't recognise any file format except ntfs or fat
